articles.headline: China’s ‘Belt and Road’ Plan in Pakistan Takes a Military Turn
articles.snippet: Under a program China insisted was peaceful, Pakistan is cooperating on distinctly defense-related projects, including a secret plan to build new fighter jets.
articles.abstract: Under a program China insisted was peaceful, Pakistan is cooperating on distinctly defense-related projects, including a secret plan to build new fighter jets.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan — When President Trump started the new year by suspending billions of dollars of security aid to Pakistan, one theory was that it would scare the Pakistani military into cooperating better with its American allies.

articles.headline: Fed Raises Interest Rates, Showing Confidence in Health of Economy
articles.snippet: Jerome H. Powell, the Fed chairman, defended the decision to raise the benchmark rate for the fifth consecutive quarter, a move made despite political pressure and financial market worries.
articles.abstract: Jerome H. Powell, the Fed chairman, defended the decision to raise the benchmark rate for the fifth consecutive quarter, a move made despite political pressure and financial market worries.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Reserve raised its benchmark interest rate on Wednesday and signaled that it expects additional rate increases next year in a display of measured confidence in the economy that came despite financial market worries and political pressure to suspend rate increases.

articles.headline: Catholic Church in Illinois Withheld Names of at Least 500 Priests Accused of Abuse, Attorney General Says
articles.snippet: After opening an investigation into clergy sex abuse against minors in Illinois in August, the state attorney general released preliminary findings on Wednesday.
articles.abstract: After opening an investigation into clergy sex abuse against minors in Illinois in August, the state attorney general released preliminary findings on Wednesday.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Catholic Church in Illinois withheld the names of at least 500 priests accused of sexual abuse of minors, the state’s attorney general said Wednesday in a scathing report that accused the church of failing victims by neglecting to investigate their allegations.
articles.byline: By Laurie Goodstein and Monica Davey

articles.headline: A Strategy of Retreat in Syria, With Echoes of Obama
articles.snippet: President Trump’s view that U.S. forces cannot alter the strategic balance in the Middle East was fundamentally shared by his immediate predecessor, Barack Obama.
articles.abstract: President Trump’s view that U.S. forces cannot alter the strategic balance in the Middle East was fundamentally shared by his immediate predecessor, Barack Obama.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump has always taken a contrarian’s view of American military power: He wants to command the biggest, toughest forces on earth, and he wants to keep them at home.

articles.headline: Global Trade Tensions Boil Over at Staid W.T.O. Forum
articles.snippet: In Geneva, the United States faced accusations that Trump trade policies are undermining the global economy. China portrayed itself as the voice of reason.
articles.abstract: In Geneva, the United States faced accusations that Trump trade policies are undermining the global economy. China portrayed itself as the voice of reason.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — The Americans accused the Chinese of being modern-day mercantilists who steal intellectual property. The Europeans accused the Americans of provoking a crisis in the world trading system, threatening the global economy.

articles.headline: Secret Experiment in Alabama Senate Race Imitated Russian Tactics
articles.snippet: A project to help the Democratic contender, Doug Jones, in his closely contested race against Roy Moore used deception on Facebook and Twitter.
articles.abstract: A project to help the Democratic contender, Doug Jones, in his closely contested race against Roy Moore used deception on Facebook and Twitter.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Russia’s online election machinations came to light last year, a group of Democratic tech experts decided to try out similarly deceptive tactics in the fiercely contested Alabama Senate race, according to people familiar with the effort and a report on its results.
articles.byline: By Scott Shane and Alan Blinder

articles.headline: Facebook Rebuked for Failing to Disclose Data-Sharing Deals
articles.snippet: Lawmakers and others criticized the social network after a New York Times report revealed Facebook gave its partners extensive access to user data.
articles.abstract: Lawmakers and others criticized the social network after a New York Times report revealed Facebook gave its partners extensive access to user data.
articles.lead_paragraph: Facebook and some of the other largest technology firms in the world faced sharp criticism on Wednesday for failing to disclose the extent of the social network’s data-sharing deals, many of which went back to the company’s early years.
articles.byline: By Michael LaForgia, Nicholas Confessore and Gabriel J.X. Dance

articles.headline: Carlos Ghosn and Nissan Board Member May Soon Leave Japanese Jail
articles.snippet: Mr. Ghosn, Nissan’s embattled leader, and Greg Kelly, a member of the carmaker’s board, were detained in Tokyo more than a month ago on financial misconduct charges.
articles.abstract: Mr. Ghosn, Nissan’s embattled leader, and Greg Kelly, a member of the carmaker’s board, were detained in Tokyo more than a month ago on financial misconduct charges.
articles.lead_paragraph: Last month, Greg Kelly, a Nissan board member and aide-de-camp to the company’s embattled chairman, Carlos Ghosn, planned to join the company’s meeting as he usually did, via video conference from his home in a leafy Nashville suburb. Then he got a call from Japan.
articles.byline: By Amy Chozick and Motoko Rich

articles.headline: Gatwick Airport Shut Down by ‘Deliberate’ Drone Incursions
articles.snippet: The closure, which affected tens of thousands of travelers, shows how vulnerable airports have become to devices readily available in hobbyist shops.
articles.abstract: The closure, which affected tens of thousands of travelers, shows how vulnerable airports have become to devices readily available in hobbyist shops.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — It is one of the busiest airports in Europe. It survived World War II, when it served as a base for R.A.F. night fighters flying missions against Nazi Germany. It has just been brought to a standstill by the humble drone.
articles.byline: By Benjamin Mueller and Amie Tsang

articles.headline: Investors Are in Retreat, and the Poorest Countries Are Paying for It
articles.snippet: As the Federal Reserve raises rates, global investors are pulling their money from emerging markets, damaging the world’s most vulnerable economies.
articles.abstract: As the Federal Reserve raises rates, global investors are pulling their money from emerging markets, damaging the world’s most vulnerable economies.
articles.lead_paragraph: KADI, India — Vikram Singh is accustomed to life under the tyranny of elements he cannot control, from rains that do not fall to insects that tear at his crops. Lately one unchanging trouble is plaguing his family — rising prices.

articles.headline: The Itsy-Bitsy, Teenie-Weenie, Very Litigious Bikini
articles.snippet: Who is the rightful inventor of the blockbuster swimsuit known as the Kiini?
articles.abstract: Who is the rightful inventor of the blockbuster swimsuit known as the Kiini?
articles.lead_paragraph: On a sunny summer day in Montauk, Ipek Irgit was in the familiar situation of not knowing what she was doing with her life. It was 2012, and she was 34 years old. Earlier in the year, after having her heart broken, she had taken a vacation in Brazil, visiting Rio de Janeiro and the beach towns of Bahia. Now she was on the beach on Long Island, wearing a handmade-looking bikini with crochet and exposed elastic straps, trying to figure out what to do and who to be.
